title.narrative: F.a: Reducing vulnerablility and neglect of children in Bihar and Dungarpur through Child Sensitive Social Protection

description.narrative: The project focuses on reducing child poverty and the use of child labor. It increases the number of children regularly attending school and improves child well-being in Nalanda district of Bihar and in Dungarpur district of Rajasthan, India. Of the popula tion of Nalanda, 42 % are children and approximately 59 % of population live below the poverty line. In Nalanda, the mortality rates of children under 5 years of age are among the highest in the state of Bihar. Two thirds of the children in the district ar e malnourished and about 24 % are engaged in different forms of child labour. In Dungarpur, one in three children is malnourished and it has one of the highest levels of infant mortality in India. Child labour is a major problem with about 20 % of the chil d population being economically active. The project provides a better access to social protection schemes by children and poor households. As a result of this project, children?s nutritional status improves and an increasing number of them attend school. T he beneficiaries of this project are the most vulnerable children and their families. In Bihar, the project is implemented by Save the Children India (Bal Raksha Bharat) and in Dungarpur, it is implemented by Save the Children India (Bal Raksha Bharat) and PEDO ? People?s Education and Development Organisation.
